7.Title: 70th British Academy Film Awards - Wikiwand
7.Snippet: The 70th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were held on 12 February 2017 at the Royal Albert Hall in London, honouring the best national and foreign films of 2016. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, accolades were handed out for the best feature-length film and documentaries of any nationality that were screened at British cinemas in 2016.

Overview.Summary: At the 70th British Academy Film Awards, held at the Royal Albert Hall in London, the critically acclaimed musical La La Land dominated with five trophies (1, 6, 8, 9, 10). The ceremony, hosted by Stephen Fry, was also attended by nominees and presenters such as Sophie Turner (3), Dev Patel (4), and Aaron Taylor-Johnson (2). The ceremony was broadcast on BBC One and BBC One HD (5).

Timeline.Text: The 70th British Academy Film Awards, also known as the BAFTAs, are held at the Royal Albert Hall in London.
La La Land continues its award sweep, earning five BAFTAs including Best Film and Best Original Music.
Dev Patel attends the BAFTAs and discusses his role in Lion.
The nominations for the 2017 BAFTAs are announced.
The British Academy of Film and Television Arts confirms the attendees for the upcoming BAFTA ceremony.

It was a decision that altered the course of African history.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards will take place at the Royal Albert Hall in London on February 12, 2017 (1,3,6,8,10). The event will be hosted by Stephen Fry for the 12th time (1,7). Nominees for the awards will be announced and voted on by peers in the film industry (4,7). The film "La La Land" is expected to lead in nominations and wins (2,6). Other notable nominees include "Manchester by the Sea" and "Fences" (6). The telecast will be aired on BBC One at 9:00 p.m. (10).

The event was hosted by Stephen Fry (3) and broadcast on BBC One (3). La La Land, directed by Damien Chazelle, won the award for Leading Actress (6). Isabelle Huppert received the award for Best Actress for her role in Elle (10).

Timeline.Text: The 70th British Academy Film Awards will be held at the Royal Albert Hall, London, with Stephen Fry returning as the host.
Moonlight receives four nominations at the BAFTAs, including Best Film and acting awards for Mahershala Ali and Naomie Harris.
Sophie Turner wears a daring metallic gown to the BAFTAs, nearly suffering a wardrobe malfunction.
Emma Stone wins the BAFTA for Leading Actress for her role in La La Land.
Winners of the 2017 British Academy Film Awards are announced, with La La Land winning five awards including Best Film.
Isabelle Huppert is named one of the best dressed at the BAFTAs for her outfit.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards, also known as the BAFTAs, took place at London's Royal Albert Hall on February 12, 2017 (1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,10). The event was hosted by Stephen Fry for the 12th time (2,6). The critically acclaimed musical La La Land won five awards (1,2,6). Other notable nominees included Amy Adams for Best Actress (2), and Dev Patel and Hugh Grant for Best Supporting Actor (9,10). This was the 70th year of the BAFTA Film Awards (9).

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards were held on February 12, 2017 (7) at the Royal Albert Hall in London (1). The ceremony was hosted by Stephen Fry for the 12th time (1). La La Land won the most awards at the event, winning five and was also most nominated in 11 categories (4). The film took home the BAFTA for Best Film, Director, and Leading Actress for Emma Stone (7). The ceremony was broadcast on BBC One and BBC One HD (2).

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards (10) were held on February 12, 2017 and were hosted by Stephen Fry (10). The film La La Land (1,5,8) received the most awards, including Best Film and Best Director (1). Other notable winners included Manchester by the Sea (1,3), Lion (1,3), and I, Daniel Blake (4). The awards also honored outstanding British film (3,4), BAFTA Fellowship and Outstanding British Contribution to Cinema (5), and Best Actress (8) and Best Director (8) for La La Land.

Timeline.Text: The 70th British Academy Film Awards, or BAFTAs, will be held on Sunday, February 12, 2017 at the Royal Albert Hall in London.
The BAFTA award show will take place in Central London at the Royal Opera House.
La La Land sweeps the awards with a record-breaking seven Golden Globes and eleven BAFTA nominations.
The BAFTA award for Outstanding British Film goes to I, Daniel Blake.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards (10) were held on February 12, 2017 (1,3,4,5,7,9,10) at the Royal Albert Hall in London (1,3,4,5,7,9,10). The event was hosted by Stephen Fry (1,5,7,8,9) and featured performances from Cirque du Soleil and Sheku Kanneh-Mason (8). La La Land won the most awards (10) and was also the most nominated film (10). Other notable winners include Casey Affleck for Best Actor (3), Emma Stone for Best Actress (3), and Dev Patel for Best Supporting Actor (3,7).

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards (BAFTAs) took place on February 12, 2017 at the Royal Albert Hall in London (2). Hosted by Stephen Fry for the 12th time, the event honored the best national and foreign films of 2016 (2). The film La La Land dominated the awards with five wins, including Best Film, Director, and Leading Actress for Emma Stone (4, 5, 6). Other notable nominees included Amy Adams for Best Actress (3) and Manchester by the Sea and Lion for multiple categories (4). The BAFTA Awards are considered an indicator for potential Oscar winners (9).

Timeline.Text: The 70th British Academy Film Awards are held at the Royal Albert Hall in London, honoring the best national and foreign films of 2016.
Stephen Fry returns to host the BAFTAs for the 12th time.
The EE British Academy Film Awards winners are announced, with La La Land receiving a record-breaking seven awards.
La La Land receives a record-breaking seven nominations at the 74th Golden Globe Awards.
Damien Chazelle's La La Land wins five awards, including Best Film, Director, and Leading Actress for Emma Stone.
The BAFTA Awards 2017 nominees are revealed.
The 70th British Academy Film Awards are held, with La La Land winning in multiple categories.
The British Academy Film Awards are renamed to the EE British Academy Film Awards for sponsorship reasons.

Overview.Summary: The 70th British Academy Film Awards (BAFTAs) were held on February 12, 2017 at the Royal Albert Hall in London. Stephen Fry returned to host the star-studded event for the 12th time (2, 6, 12). La La Land, the critically-acclaimed musical, continued its sweep of awards, winning five trophies (1, 3, 7, 15). The film also led the race for the BAFTAs with four nominations (8, 10, 18). Other notable winners included Moonlight, which won six awards including Best Film (9, 13), and I, Daniel Blake, which won for Outstanding British Film (3). The ceremony also featured performances from Cirque du Soleil and Sheku Kanneh-Mason, winner of the BBC Young Musician 2016 (6, 13). The BAFTAs are an annual event that recognizes and promotes excellence in the art forms of the moving image (14, 17).

Timeline.Text: The 70th British Academy Film Awards will be held at the Royal Albert Hall in London on this day.
The EE British Academy Film Awards are held at the Royal Albert Hall, with Stephen Fry hosting for the 12th time. The critically-acclaimed musical La La Land wins five trophies.
The 70th EE British Academy Film Awards are presented in a star-studded event at London's Royal Albert Hall, with performances from Cirque du Soleil and Sheku Kanneh-Mason.
